org.safs.tools.drivers

Class EmbeddedHookDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.JavaHook
      • org.safs.tools.drivers.EmbeddedHookDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HookConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmbeddedDCHookDriver, EmbeddedSeleniumHookDriver

    public class EmbeddedHookDriver
extends JavaHook
    Allows custom JSAFS test development and execution inside a Java-based SAFS Engine. Java-based SAFS Engines would need to implement an engine-specific subclass of this EmbeddedHookDriver using a EmbeddedHookSTAFHelper to take advantage of this feature.

    Usage is expected to be: 

      
 EmbeddedHookDriverSubclass hook = new EmbeddedHookDriverSubclass("UniqueName");
 hook.run();
 ..do stuff
 hook.shutdown();

    It is important to note that the JVM arg -Dsafs.project.config is now optional. It is also possible to use -Dtestdesigner.project.config, or nothing. If neither is provided, the engine will look for a "test.ini" file in the startup working directory and also initially assume that might also be the Project Root directory.

    Author:
    Carl Nagle

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Called automatically by the 3 Constructors. Subclasses may wish to override or extend this initialization.

        sets the local hook field to the current hook driver instance and creates the internal JSAFSDriver instance.

        See Also:
        setHelper(Object)

      • getTRDData

        public TestRecordHelper getTRDData()
        Retrieve the TestRecordHelper used by the subclass.
        This will almost always be overridden by an engine-specific subclass.

        If no TestRecordHelper has been set (data == null), then the implementation is expected to instantiate and return a TestRecordHelper instance appropriate for the engine.

        A newly instantiated TestRecordHelper should have critical helpers set:

        • data.setSTAFHelper(getHelper());
        • data.setDDGUtils(getGUIUtilities());
        Specified by:
        getTRDData in class JavaHook

      • getGUIUtilities

        public DDGUIUtilities getGUIUtilities()
        Subclasses should override this method to retrieve/create the DDGUIUtilities instance needed by the specific engine subclass.

        A newly instantiated DDGUIUtilities should have critical helpers set:

        • utils.setSTAFHelper(getHelper());
        • utils.setTestRecordData(getTRDData());

        Note that the call to getTRDData() may force the instantiation of the default TestRecordHelper if one has not already been set.

        Specified by:
        getGUIUtilities in class JavaHook
        Returns:
        DDGUIUtilities which should be an instanceof org.safs.DDGUIUtilities subclass. This default superclass implementation instantiates a DCGUIUtilities object that cannot act on GUI components.
        See Also:
        JavaHook.getHelper(), getTRDData(), DCGUIUtilities

      • getLogUtilities

        public LogUtilities getLogUtilities()
        Use this method to retrieve/create the current/default LogUtilities instance. If the LogUtilities has not been set this routine will instance a new org.safs.LogUtilities.
        Specified by:
        getLogUtilities in class JavaHook
        Returns:
        LogUtilities which should be an instanceof org.safs.LogUtilities.
        See Also:
        JavaHook.getLogUtilities(), org.safs.LogUtilities

      • getEngineDriverCommandProcessor

        protected Processor getEngineDriverCommandProcessor()
        Subclasses should instantiate an engine-specific DriverCommands Processor here. Other generic SAFS DriverCommand Processors will get chained to this primary Processor.
        Returns:
        Engine-specific DriverCommands Processor instance, or null.

      • getEngineTestStepProcessor

        protected Processor getEngineTestStepProcessor()
        Subclasses should instantiate an engine-specific TestStepProcessor Processor here, if any. Other generic SAFS Processors, if any, will get chained to this primary Processor.
        Returns:
        Engine-specific TestStepProcessor Processor instance, or null.

      • getEngineEngineCommandProcessor

        protected Processor getEngineEngineCommandProcessor()
        Subclasses should instantiate an engine-specific EngineCommandProcessor Processor here, if any. Other generic SAFS Processors, if any, will get chained to this primary Processor.
        Returns:
        Engine-specific EngineCommandProcessor Processor instance, or null.

      • getRequestProcessor

        public ProcessRequest getRequestProcessor()
        This method to retrieve/create the current/default ProcessRequest instance. The user would not normally call or override this routine as it will be called internally.

        If the ProcessRequest has not been set this routine will instance a new org.safs.ProcessRequest and populate it with the LogUtilities via getLogUtilities(), a TestRecordHelper via getTRDData(), and all Processors.

        Any newly created ProcessRequest instance will invoke:

          getEngineDriverCommandProcessor()
          getEngineTestStepProcessor()
          getEngineEngineCommandProcessor()

        and attempt to initialize all Processors with the getLogUtilities() and getTRDData() calls and then chain all Processors appropriately.

        Note that the first call to getTRDData() may force the instantiation of the default TestRecordHelper for the subclass, if one has not already been set.

        The first call to getLogUtilities() may also force the instantiation of the default LogUtilities, if one has not already been set.

        Specified by:
        getRequestProcessor in class JavaHook
        Returns:
        ProcessRequest which should be an instanceof org.safs.ProcessRequest
        See Also:
        TestRecordHelper, getTRDData(), getLogUtilities(), org.safs.LogUtilities, getEngineDriverCommandProcessor(), getEngineTestStepProcessor(), getEngineEngineCommandProcessor()

      • setProcessName

        protected void setProcessName(java.lang.String process_name)
        Override superclass to delay STAFHelper initialization.
        Overrides:
        setProcessName in class JavaHook

      • setHelper

        public void setHelper(java.lang.Object processhelper)
        Set our STAFHelper to be the one provided. Optionally, the input parameter can be a String which represents the process name for the desired STAFHelper (that may or may not exist).

        The user can initialize both the process name and the STAFHelper by calling this routine with a valid process name String or STAFHelper.

        If the current instance already has a defined process name, then any process name provided here is ignored and the STAFHelper is initialized with the existing value.

        If the user provides a valid STAFHelper; then the process_name will be set to the name used to create the STAFHelper.

        NOTE: This will automatically reset the semaphore_name to be the same as the process_name. This is the default mode of operation and should be OK for most applications. However, if the semaphore_name is to be different, then you must also call setSemaphoreName after this call.

        Overrides:
        setHelper in class JavaHook
        Parameters:
        processhelper - -- Object: String process name used to create/retrieve a STAFHelper; or an already instanced STAFHelper object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (with message) -- if null is provided.

      • initConfigPaths

        protected void initConfigPaths()
        Override the superclass's method, try to use the existing Configuration of the embedded driver. If the existing Configuration is null, then call method of superclass.
        Overrides:
        initConfigPaths in class JavaHook
        See Also:
        DriverConstant.PROPERTY_SAFS_CONFIG_PATHS, ConfigureInterface, TestRecordHelper.setConfig(ConfigureInterface), TestRecordHelper.getConfig()

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: JavaHook
        Insert this SAFS Engine hook into the STAF system. The hook will then be enabled and ready for test events from any STAF client using the correct Event protocols.
        Overrides:
        start in class JavaHook

      • evaluateRuntimeException

        protected long evaluateRuntimeException(java.lang.RuntimeException ex)
        Evaluate if the runtime hook should shutdown or continue. Currently, we only suggest shutdown on a USER_STOPPED_SCRIPT_REQUEST-- which can be initiated by the SAFS Monitor or the value of the safs_driver_control variable.
        Overrides:
        evaluateRuntimeException in class JavaHook

      • run

        public void run()
        Called to initialize the EmbeddedDriver and make it ready for use. The user is expected to call shutdown() when testing is completed.

        Invokes:

        See Also:
        org.safs.tools.drivers.JSAFSDriver#removeShutdownHook()
        , org.safs.tools.drivers.JSAFSDriver#validateRootConfigureParameters(boolean)

        , org.safs.tools.drivers.JSAFSDriver#initializeMiscConfigInfo()

        , org.safs.tools.drivers.JSAFSDriver#openTestLogs()
        , org.safs.tools.drivers.JSAFSDriver#statuscounter

      • allowSystemExit

        protected boolean allowSystemExit()
        Description copied from class: JavaHook
        Evaluate if the runtime hook should exit with System.exit(0).

        The default implementation will return true allowing the System.exit(0). Subclasses may wish to override this function to prevent the execution of System.exit(0) when this is not appropriate.

        Overrides:
        allowSystemExit in class JavaHook

      • shutdown

        public boolean shutdown()
        Perform final engine hook shutdown activities AND shutdown the internal JSAFSDriver. This should shutdown all SAFS logs and services started by this process.

        This default implementation unregisters our STAFProcessHelper if it is not null. Subclasses may wish to provide additional functionality before calling super.shutdown().

        Returns:
        The default implementation will return true if no errors or exceptions are uncaught.
